definition: to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: They dishonored her so much that she turned from them in disgust.
sentences.chinese: 她受玷污之後，遂即厭棄了他們。

sentences.english: Carmen becomes tired of Don Jose and falls in love with the handsome matador Escamillo.
sentences.chinese: 卡門逐漸厭棄唐豪塞而愛上了鬥牛士埃斯卡米里奧。

sentences.english: For the same reason, our party abhors the deification of an individual.
sentences.chinese: 因爲這樣，我們黨也厭棄對於個人的神化。

sentences.english: This is a form of self-rejection.
sentences.chinese: 這是自我厭棄的一種形式。

sentences.english: For the sake of David your servant, do not reject your anointed one.
sentences.chinese: 求你因你僕人大衛的緣故，不要厭棄你的受膏者。

sentences.english: If you're the type who gets bored on a beach, consider marrying here, within easy reach of some of Paris's top attractions.
sentences.chinese: 如果你厭棄了海灘的枯燥，就考慮來這裏結婚吧。

sentences.english: This dreariness is the beginning and also the source of another pursuit.
sentences.chinese: 厭棄是另外一種追慕的開始，也是追慕的根源。

definition: to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to run in the opposite direction (idiom); to run counter to
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
